detailsOfAchievement: Our Programs strength-Psychosocial Care- Sneha Abhiyan addressing the psychological distress and depression resulting from the trauma of death and devastation around the survivors of the cyclone became the major focus of Sneha Abhiyan. Sneha Abhiyan and doctors from NIMHANS and child counsellors trained a group of local volunteers on psychosocial counselling and play therapy. Education- Our partner community in Erasama likes to stay in the middle of their farm land. Due to this distance of one household from other is more and villages remain scattered. Education was not a priority within the community as the parents are busy with farming and fishing. Livelihood-The livelihood program envisages self-sustaining communities by seeking opportunities for young people and women to avail of skills trainings, information and resources for community livelihood projects. Sneha Abhiyan has given stress on the women empowerment to ensure them their right to food and livelihood. Water and Sanitation-The water and sanitation program addresses the issues of lack of access to safe drinking water and sanitary toilets, poor quality and water governance, poor garbage disposal and drainage systems. WomenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s rights- The women community are, many a time, facing exploitation and torture. Many of them are aware of their rights through which they can safeguard themselves. In order to make the fair sex aware of their rights and empowerment Sneha Abhiyan is working sincerely to champion the cause of women. They have network of activities in 18 Panchayats. Liasioning with Government -The Sneha Abhiyan is always working as a bridge between community and government agencies.Various awareness campaigns are organized to educate the people on the benefits of the schemes. Support to PWDs for certificate and aid -Sneha Abhiyan has launched programmes in its DAs for the awareness of the Persons With Disability about schemes aimed at their development. There are 90 PWDs beneficiaries identified for pension schemes and 95 for getting PWDs certificates this year. Federation Management Training to Sangathan - Sneha Abhiyan conducted capacity building training camps for women federations. Two management training camps were held in Erasama and Balikuda this year. Capacity Building of Disable Sangathana - Steps have been taken to include the PWDs for helping them stand up self-dependent in the society through capacity building measures. There was a two-day training camp for the leaders in Erasama with the participation of PWDs leaders belonging to Erasama and Balikuda blocks. Governance- The governance program cuts across areas where Sneha Abhiyan works. It promotes citizen and community (women and youth) participation, transparent and accountable public governance, improved public service delivery, and social accountability through productive engagement with government, networking and policy dialogue

detailsOfAchievement: EDUCATION & TRAINING: We have created and managed Kanyashrama in contractorpada of Kandhamala district where more than 100 pupils have been admitted. We provide them free shelters, free foodings and free education. Even though we have awaiting Grants-in-Aid from GOI in this regard but we continue in this endeavour for more than five years. We have undertaken many vocational training programmes under various schemes of National Skill Development Council (NSDC) of Government of India. AGRICULTURE: We conducted many agricultural training programmes with the presence of agricultural engineers to many local farmers and cultivators with the aim of maximum benefits with lower efforts. HEALTH: Being our place of work is mostly tribal based, they are poor people and could not afford for many health hazards. We have conducted many health awareness programmes and created health consciousness among these peoples. WOMEN EMPOWERMENTS: We created many Self Help Groups (SHGs) and constantly involve them in many incomes generating activities and thereby ensuring their confidence and awareness. BANKING SERVICE CORRESPONDENT: We are carrying Banking service as a circle level Business correspondent of State Bank of India (SBI). Currently we have opened more than six lakhs accounts in the state and we are the No.1 BC in the state. We are also the maximum commission payer in the state in this regard.

detailsOfAchievement: SUPRATIVA is a non-profit making voluntary organisation that works for the development of under privileged class in the state of Orissa. It focuses on primary education, reproductive health, rural livelihood and human rights. It also addresses issues such as health and sanitation, disaster management, science

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Project Started in Cuttack city. Major activities were strengthening and operationalisation of Mahila Arogya Samiti, immunization, observance of Urban Heath Nutrition Day, fictionalization of Ward Kalyan Samiti, development of Slum Resource Map.

With support receiving from the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India the organisation organised Nai Roshni Programme that endeavours to provide leadership development of minority women, especially for development of women belonging to notified minority communities. The specific aim of the scheme was to empower and instil confidence among women by providing knowledge, tool and techniques for interacting with Government system and others at all levels.

National Council for Science & Technology (NCSTC), Department of Science & Technology, Govt. of India sanctioned a project to conduct one TOT and five regional level training programme on â€œMathematical Model Making & Problem Solving for Secondary School Teachersâ€ to â€œSUPRATIVA.â€.

As a NGO partner of the Ministry, â€œSUPRATIVAâ€ conducted leadership development training programme in Cuttack District of Odisha. The organization completed nine training programmes, benefiting 225 women within five months time. The main objective of the leadership development programme was to empower the women from the minority communities.

A Population Based Screening Programme for Non Communicable Diseases (NCDs) was conducted by SUPRATIVA in the month of May and September, 2017. This was a collaboration programme with the National Health Mission (NHM), Cuttack. Total 218 Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHAs) were trained through this programme.

SUPRATIVA in association with National Commission for Women (NCW), Govt. of India organized a State Level Seminar on â€œAdvancing Role of Women in combating Climate Changeâ€ on 17th March 2019 at Hotel La Franklin, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. The programme focused various aspects of climate change issues including recent changes in climate, vulnerabilities of women under climate change situation, sharing of good practices, identifying roles and responsibilities of women in climate change scenarios.
Completed Refresher Training for ASHAs under National Health Mission.
Completed State Level Seminar Climate Change supported by National Commission for Women.

detailsOfAchievement: The activities of the society covers socio-economic, cultural, physical, psychological, agricultural, environmental, rural development & educational spheres of community covering mostly ST, SC and weaker sections of the Society. The emphasis was particularly on women and children. Empowerment of the weak has been the basic motto of all our activities during the year. 1. EDUCATION COMPLEX The Markelguda Residential Education Complex with 210 tribal girl students is functioning successfully with students from Class I to VII. The school is comparable to Central Schools like Kendriya Vidyalaya & Navodaya Vidyalaya. 2. NATIONAL CHILD LABOUR PROJECT ( N C L P ) The Society is running 2 nos. of NCLP School with 100 child labours for eradication of Child Labour and promotion of education among them. 3. AROGYA PLUS (HEALTH PROGRAMME) UNDER NRHM. The society is running AROGYA Plus health programme from January, 2012 in Bardual and Madkapadar G.Ps of Khairput block with support from NRHM with an AYUSH doctor, Pharmacist, ANM, Community Mobiliser, Attendant-cum-Driver with an Ambulance. 4. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENT AWARENESS CAMPAIGN (N E A C) National Environment Awareness Campaign activities were organized both in Hindol and Malkangiri project areas with participation of various stakeholders covering students, SHGs and the general public on the topic of Bio-diversity Conservation. 5. ORISSA TRIBAL EMPOWERMENT & LIVELIHOOD PROGRAMME (O T E L P) The Society has completed 5 years of intensive work in the project area of Nandapur & Semiliguda in Koraput district. With 2 OTELP Plus Projects in Nandapur-Pottangi and Korukonda-Khairput the Society is working in 43 Micro Watersheds covering 75 villages and 30 hamlets promoting holistic development of the tribal people and others. Our major intervention is in the field of land and water management. 6. ODAF INITIATIVE TOWARDS SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT Ã¢â‚¬â€œ PHASE-IV Under ODAF programme the Society continued empowerment programme with educational assistance, support to Gram Sabha & Palli Sabha, support to peoples network covering OAAA (Odisha Adivasi Adhikar Abhijan), capacity enhancement programme of the community and of the staff and awareness programme through media resource centre in all the 3 projects of Hindol, Malkangiri & Phiringia. The programme covered 2 G.Ps each in Hindol & Malkangiri & one G.P. of Phiringia in Kandhamal district. Under Secured Sustainable Livelihood (SSL), the Society has taken up Land development, agricultural assistance, seed support through seed bank, community forestry through nursery raising and plantation, income generation through Self-Help Group. Community Health care & nutrition for mother and children under 5 is a major programme. 7. GREENING INDIA PROGRAMME The Society has taken up Greening activities through plantation of cashew, mango & other indigenous plants for last 18 years covering plantation area of 9000 acres with support from Felisimo Forest Foundation, Japan through TSRD, Kolkata. 8. ODISHA COMMUNITY TANK DEVELOPMENT & MANAGEMENT PROJECT Ã¢â‚¬â€œ KHAMAR. With support from World Bank through Water Resources Deptt., the Society facilitated peoples participation in management of 3 M.I.Ps of Andhari, Gandijora & Khanatapasi with 5 Pani Panchayats in 11 villages with 1089 households of Khamar in Pallahara block of Angul district.
